name: Traveller's Inn on Douglas

reviews.title: Not the best, not the worst
reviews.text: I checked out their website; this hotel seemed to be in a great location and had an okay price. But when we got there, it turned out to be almost dumpy--not quite a full dump but very close. The hotel lobby where you check in was nice and flashy but then when we went to the building next door where our room was in, the lobby smelled strongly of grease and oil ! Our room was very dark and featured old furniture. The bathroom had bar soap which is not hygienic. The beds were alright and I did not see any any bugs during our stay. The TV was pretty big and there was ample table space. Overall, the room was very dark and dingy. I pulled out some kleenex from the box provided in our room and found some to have blue stains--so I pulled out more and more and found the stains to be getting larger and larger. I have a feeling that the housekeeping is refilling kleenex into the boxes rather than buying individual boxes and some of their cleaning chemicals spilled onto the tissues. The housekeeping girl was very helpful and friendly. The hotel does charge for local calls which is ridiculous because you know there is no charge from the phone company for making a local call. We complained that they never informed us about this and they credited back the amount. The hotel is located on the bus route, which was excellent for us. I would have given this hotel a better review but the room rate is overpriced for what you actually receive.

reviews.title: False Advertising
reviews.text: What do you expect when you book a stay-and-play golf package in a hotel? Well, you stay in their hotel and they can book a t-time for you but with additional cost, i.e. green fee + handling charge.

reviews.title: Great value at Traveller's Inn
reviews.text: What do you get with a coupon specifying a $20 discount upon presentation of this coupon? Well, it applies only on a few days of the year, at 2 out of the 5 or 6 hotels in the list, and when you so happen to walk-in and book the hotel without prior reservation.

reviews.title: What a Great Place to stay.......
reviews.text: Location is within walking distance of downtown Victoria and is on the busline. Although the location seemed a bit industrial on the surface, it was quiet, safe, and inviting. Some rooms are equipped with kitchenettes, which was much appreciated after a week's worth of eating out. King sized beds, laundry facilities, air conditioning (apparently a rarity in Victoria) and a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Ask them for restaurant recommendations!!!

reviews.title: Good for 1 night
reviews.text: First let me say the Front Desk were really nice and helpful, I booked a room for my son and myself. I was offered 2 kings sounds great $139cdn, even better they price matched @ $79 which I had seen on another website.

reviews.title: Ok, but I'd stay somewhere else next time
reviews.text: BUT the room was so narrow you could hardly move around the beds and the bathroom was really tiny.

reviews.title: Great deal for jacuzzi
reviews.text: I would have not been happy at $139 but for $79 I got what I paid for. They do have free parking and a shuttle to downtown which could have been useful if we had taken advantage.

reviews.title: Real vacation bummer - not worth the price
reviews.text: I have heard its $49 in the winter so if I was to return again then and have my husband a couple of kids with me I would give it another go.

reviews.title: Non-Smoking Room Smelled Like an Ashtray
reviews.text: Our non-smoking room smelled like a dirty ashtray, the TV didn't work and a lamp was missing a bulb. Front desk was informed immediately and they were going to take care of it well the four of us were at dinner. Came back and nothing had been done. Front desk phoned at 11pm to apologize and offer another room. I was already in bed and unable to move all the gear for four people.

reviews.title: Never stay here!
reviews.text: We didn't have time to change rooms the next day due to an early race start. Came back after housekeeping had been through and none of our complaints had been taken care of. NONE

reviews.title: Great time in Victoria
reviews.text: I'm not asking much from a budget motel but don't give me a smoking room and call it non-smoking. The rooms are dark and the extra light would have been nice (or scary). Would have liked to watch some TV after getting sick from a bad sandwich from a certain garden.

reviews.title: Unexpected Delight
reviews.text: After staying here, all other budget hotels I've been in seem luxurious!

reviews.title: Wasn't the best for the price you pay
reviews.text: We stayed there a week in Sept 2007.
